person.note: Wang(1) Zao [11625] Zao was either assigned or took it upon himself to draft funerary inscriptions for many people purged during Cai(1) Jing's [1649] tenure in control of state. Therefore check subjects of his efforts for coalitional data. His first wife was born Zhao, and he accompanied Zhao(1) Yi [362] on his travels as a member of Yi's yindang or kindred group. Chronological logic would, therefore, make Zao a son-in-law of Zhao(1) Lin [369], which is so recorded until I CHECK funerary inscription. Xinan zhi, 8.9a. CBD, 1, 711-712.
